page.syntax: Selections as P = ui_get_check2P(C title ,C selected ,C choices [,C headingText [,L hasSelectAllLink [,L hasUnselectAllLink [,L hasWildcardSelectLink [,N width [,N height [,C scrollingMode [,L resizeable [,C xbInitialize [,* opsIn ]]]]]]]]]])

argument.name: Selections
argument.description: A pointer variable with two properties.

item.name: .LastButton
item.description: C, The name of the last button clicked.

item.name: .Selected
item.description: C, A CR-LF delimited list of the user's selections.

argument.name: selected
argument.description: A CR-LF list of the default selections.

argument.name: choices
argument.description: A CR-LF delimited list of choices to display.

argument.name: hasSelectAllLink
argument.description: Optional. Default = .T. . When the value it .T., the Select_All button appears.

argument.name: hasUnselectAllLink
argument.description: Optional. Default = .T. . When the value it .T., the Un-Select_All button appears.

argument.name: hasWildcardSelectLink
argument.description: Optional. Default = .T. . When the value it .T., the Wildcard Select button appears.

argument.name: width
argument.description: Optional. Default = 80. The width of the dialog in characters.

argument.name: height
argument.description:
Optional. Default = 25.
The height of the dialog in lines.

page.description: Dislay a multi-column list of choices, allowing a user to select entries by checking entries. Returns .lastbutton, .selected, .selected_in_selection_order
page.discussion: The UI_GET_CHECK2P() function displays a list of check boxes. If necessary, the display will be multi-column.

section.title: Example
section.description: This example displays a single column of check boxes.
section.example: ui_get_check2p("Multi-column list of choices", "blue", choices, "Heading text", .t., .t., .t., 25, 7)

section.description: This example displays a single column of check boxes.
section.example: ui_get_check2p("Multi-column list of choices", defaults, choices, "Heading text", .t., .t., .t., 50, 6)
